column4: Hello, anyone can tell me how i can connetc to PC's by the USB Direct Link? anyone do it? (sorry i know my english is so bad)
Ethernet over USB? Is that what you mean?
crdlb: I'ts a USB direct Link cable goes on usb port's and make a "network" for 2 pc's
crdlb: But i don't see nothing
Is this a special usb cable? Some device you bought? or Just a standard one?
yes it's a special cable the same conectors in both sides, (i hope you understand me)
i read something about "usbnet driver" but i don't know how it works....if i connect the cable nothing happen
Ethernet over usb is not a common thing (interesting though) have you got a link?
http://www.linux-usb.org/usbnet/
Looking.
So you have one of these special cables then?
Cool.

From the look of it you can 'sudo modprobe usbnet' to get the driver and then check 'dmesg' to see if devices have been recognised. BTW 'ethtool' is a great prog for looking at ethernet devices and seeing what the hardware is running at.
i try rigth now tnx
i got that http://paste.ubuntu-nl.org/8980/
Ok. So usbnet is loaded. You still want the end of dmesg to see what device name it's given your device. Or ifconfig. then 'sudo ethtool ethX' (or whatever)
nothing on dmesg
ok thank a lot y search........
'ifconfig' ?
Once you've got a device listed then you need to assign and IP to it.. I hope this is worth it. You'd be better off with a couple of network cards... Anyway. Good lukc.
http://paste.ubuntu-nl.org/8981/
